title: Thoughts about the new Akali
body:
I can't really make this post without sounding like a boosted bonobo but hear me out.

Akali sucks,

Thank you.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Joesaurus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Us8OihqW,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-11-20T12:26:08.243+0000)
>
> Akali sucks

Accurate statement.
I don't know why Riot decided against updating her to the same degree as Talon or Leblanc. It seems like she needed it more.

Because Akali is on the list for a total VGU, which is more than they did to Talon or Leblanc. It would be wasted effort if they reworked Akali by a huge ammount, just to rework her again even harder.

Pretty much, it was a similar treatment to what Swain received back with the Mage update, what they should done with Morde & what happened to Shaco here too. Some small gameplay love now while players wait for a much larger update later.

Now they just have to buff this version of Akali to a decent level & leave her their till her VGU happens. Which is going to take a while to get to. There's a good number of other champs who are likely to get updated before her.

I've been watching some of Professor Akali's videos on YouTube and it's just sad to watch an avid Akali main failing to assassinate anything so often. I've watched him repeatedly dive Marksmen without allies next to them and dying because she doesn't have the burst to kill them. Sometimes he gets everything lined up and does a nice burst of damage...and then can't do anything for 2-3 seconds because all of her stuff is on cooldown. He has to build partly tanky just to survive her cooldowns and has to shroud in almost every fight.

And the carries still escape because Akali can't go after them while her stuff is on cooldown. I swear the ult cooldown nerf has screwed him more than any other change.
Weren't the assassin changes to prevent 100-0 people? Isn't killing marksman near their allies the things assassins aren't supposed to do?

if an assassin gets on your carry they should die every time unless your support has great reactions

right now the support could be completely oblivious and still react in time to save their ADC, and the assassin can make the correct play and still die without killing them because of all the delays shoved into their kit.

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Us8OihqW,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2016-11-20T19:32:54.440+0000)
>
> if an assassin gets on your carry they should die every time unless your support has great reactions

No, that's absolutely not true. That was the entire purpose to the assassin rework was specifically to make it so that wasn't how they worked by giving them counterplay.

the counterplay to an assassin was not letting them do that. good warding to prevent flanks and paying attention to where you are in a teamfight

there is absolutely no reason that a carry should get outflanked and caught alone and be able to kill the assassin in a duel. inexcusable.

Yeah, that isn't how counterplay works. Counterplay is 'you did something, here's what I can do to mitigate what you just did'. Counterplay is dodging a skillshot, it's standing next to allies to prevent Kha'Zix's isolation damage, it's backing off when you see Gnar's rage bar is getting full, it's watching your opponent blow cooldowns and knowing they have no abilities left to use. Warding to prevent flanks is good game sense, but it isn't counterplay, especially with the changes to stealth.

taking preventative measures is counterplay

there's too much counterplay to assassins now.
Certain assassins who are perhaps undertuned maybe, but to assassins as a whole? Not at all.
The only assassins with a positive winrate right now are Khazix and Rengar...

Champs with higher skill requirements typically tend to have below positive win rates because the average player can't actually play them well. LeBlanc, Zed, and Ekko have always been on the higher end difficulty wise, and while Kat used to be simple, the skill required to play her went through the fucking roof with her update. If any of those 4 have positive win rates it means they're probably overpowered. Akali is admittedly pretty trash right now, which is why she's the first assassin to be getting buffs. Talon, Shaco, and Fizz I'm not familiar with enough to comment on.

EDIT: Here's an example. LeBlanc's win rate has always been below 50%, but it's actually increased since her rework.

No, assassins are suppose to be able to 100-0 people. If they couldn't do so then there would be absolutely no point to play them over fighters & mages. The point of the rework was to extend their burst windows and provide more counterplay.

Of course, In they case of Rengar for example they completely failed (can still 100-0 in less than half a second), but that was the goal of the rework.
He prolly hasn't adapted to the new akali though

"Has to Shroud almost every fight"

Oh no. A champion depending on the defensive tool in their kit. What a balance nightmare.

I tried her due to the changes. I rarely play assassins and have luttle experience but I felt like her damage was very low. I was also totally disappointed with the blink added to her Twilight Shroud.

I think her Q should be procced by Cresent Slash and her Ulti. I also would like to see Twlight Shroud's blink much longer. If the AoE was smaller but it was a true blink and left smoke clouds at both locations it would allow for more gameplay.

I would like to see more gameplay with her Ulti instead of it being a dash that deals a little damage. Perhaps if she dashes from Twilight Shroud to a enemy she stays invisible for 0.5 sec.

Riot wanted minor changes since they plan a full rework and VU. But I think they could have done more without needing to invest a ton of art into new effects. Just some added functionality.

Each assassin should have a niche, I don't see what Akali's is, she has low damage and very little disengage. Pick her if you want a challenge?

I changed my mind new Akali is actually the best champion in the game

http://i.imgur.com/BOHHrQV.png[/img]

Hey, I just came by to tell you my thoughts about the Akali update.

I played Akali every day for half a year, untill you removed the Q procs on her E. After that I started play various other champs, which is actually a good thing. I googled every month, looking for information about when the champion I enjoyed the most would once again be playable, then I read after the Taric rework. Something like a year later, the Taric rework arrived, and I was told to wait another year (I believe) for the assassin update, where Akali was a central part. At that point, I got really mad, and abandoned League of Legends until Rito was able do to what they promised. Now, the Akali rework has arrived, and it is done extremely poorly.

There is no synergy between any of her abilities.

Her passive is worse in terms of healing AND damage, the old passive made her deal more damage on the 1st AA, and all AAs after the second, and added some spellvamp that was the only way to survive in lane. ATM the new passive only gives slightly more damage on the second AA.

The E, which is pretty much only useful for waveclear since you removed Q procs has reduced dps, which hurts her waveclear and split pushing capabilities.

The non reducable cooldown on R makes you unable to chase anything down as soon you are hit by ANY kind of CC. But hey! Why would you want to chase people anyway, when all you are actually good at is to hide in your W?

TLDR; My boycott goes on until the sun is extinguished, Hell freezes over, and Akali gets the love she needs utterly. In fact, I believe that Graves will get his cigar back before Akali gets the promissed update.

Do you think it is damage in general? Cooldown gating? Or a combination of the two in her rotation? I remember before the best way to get all your damage was to Q someone and then shroud (which should be easier in fights with the free hop with W) Dash > proc the Q/passive> Q> proc. 

I'm not an avid akali player or anything, but I'm just not sure what can be changed without changes in her kit functionality... E still feels kind of worthless except as an energy dump (at least I have yet to see a reason to use it over anything else) or am I missing something with her E?

E is very usefull for life stealing minions and hitting minions that are slightly out of auto attack range. But you have a point, it has no synergy what so ever after they removed the Q procs, and now it doesnt even proc her passive.
E WAS useful. Now that the only spellvamp she has is the one from gunblade, E does heals for next to nothing since it's AoE.
yeah

I mean, I only played against her twice but she felt as stupid as always, losing lane hard and then coming back killing everything lol.
I also won both games in the end tho so yeah... idk
